column4: I am looking for the package updater program I cant find it in synaptic can somebody tell me the name please?
does kubuntu have issues running the update-manager?
nope
I for some reason cannot run it except from terminal....
how else would you run it?
umm via the icon that it installed perhaps?
I don't think it installs one, I think it has some gnome way of launching that doesn't show up in kde
its in the menu in gnome if you look
same with kde
under system it says update manager 'ubuntu update manager'
that's update-manager, which runs for me, thought you wanted update-notifier which sits in the system tray
I run eitehr they dont work right....
its odd....
I think it default uses command gksudo or soemthing so its not doing that and well...
gksu was not installed that was the problem now to figure out how to get the icon of the updater to look good in kde :)
you should file a report on bugzilla, it should have a dependency on gtsudo
I'd guess that gnome doesn't do transparancy on it's panel, or if it doesn't they don't talk to each other about it.
poke me and I'll write an update-notifier for KDE
if you nano /etc/group and remove that user from admin no su should be allowed correct? I dont know I tried to find the most likely equivelent to wheel in gentoo and that only makes sense
sudo won't be allowed, su will
hmm ok
do you have /etc/kderc?
you can join #kubuntu
